summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center, transmitting discovery materials to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell for her access in the criminal case against her.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center to whom discovery materials are being provided in her criminal case.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: She is the Assistant U.S. Attorney who signed the letter transmitting discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Strauss, as an Assistant U.S. Attorney, is part of the prosecution team providing discovery to the defendant, Maxwell.

events.title: Discovery Transmission to Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office transmits discovery materials to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is a formal correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
It confirms Ghislaine Maxwell was an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn as of November 18, 2020.
The prosecution, represented by Assistant U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss, was providing discovery materials to the defendant.
The document illustrates the ongoing legal proceedings and evidence exchange in Maxwell's case.
